document.docAuthor: West, Rick C. & Nunn, Steven C.
document.docTitle: Coremiocnemis brachyramosa West & Nunn 2010, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types:
female holotype , female paratype , S83826, S83825 , respectively, Gunung Ledang ( 2° 22' N , 102° 36' E ), Johor , West Malaysia , col. J.-M. Verdez , 2008, QM –examined; male paratype , S83927 , Gunung Ledang , Johor , West Malaysia , col. V. Sejna and S. Monsa , date unknown, QM –examined
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 31–32. 31.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , holotype female QM S83826 habitus. 32.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , male habitus. Photos: 31, F. Cleton and J.-M. Verdez; 32, G. Sposato.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology: A compound adjective whose first element is the Greek adjective brachy meaning ‘short’ or ‘small’ and the second element is the feminine Latin adjective ramosa meaning ‘branching’ that defines the unique spermathecal morphology that is diagnostic to this species.

Diagnosis: Differs from all other
Coremiocnemis species
in the presence of uniquely multiple branching spermathecae, uniformly sclerotized ( Fig. 37 ) and intense blue coloration entirely in females ( Fig. 31 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 33–38.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , holotype female QM S83826. 33. Carapace, dorsal view. 34. Eyes, dorsal view. 35. Sternum, labium, maxillae and coxae, ventral view. 36. Labium, ventral view. 37. Spermathecae, dorsal view. 38. Posterior habitus, dorsal view. Scale bar = 10mm for 33, 38; 5mm for 35; 2mm for 34, 36 and 37.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: Female holotype QM S83826 ( Fig. 31 ) with body length: 40.06.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 39–44.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , holotype female QM S83826 (39–42), paratype female QM S83825 (43, 44). 39. Left legs III and IV, dorsal view. 40. Left met. and tar. IV, retrolateral view. 41. Left met. and tar. IV, ventral view. 42. Left met. and tar. IV, prolateral view. 43. Left maxillae, prolateral view. 44. Left maxillary lyra, prolateral view. Scale bar = 10mm for 39–42; 3mm for 43; 2mm for 44.

subSubSection.paragraph: Maxillae ( Figs 35 , 43 ): prolaterally plano-convex, anterior lobe well pronounced, many cuspules ( > 180) on inner basoventral surface. Maxillary lyra ( Fig. 44 ): large number of bacilliform rods (>200) in dense, ovoid patch on prolateral face, lowest row with>24 bacillae, longest rods in centre of lowest row. Rods paddleshaped with medium to long shafts, largest with distal blades. At highest point, lyrate patch is>10 rows deep, smallest rods dorsally. Posterior end of patch truncate, anterior end slightly pointed distad/rounded. Dorsal to suture>60 small spines on anterior margin of maxillae, rows unordered.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 45–50.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , holotype female QM S83826 (50), paratype female QM S83825 (45–49). 45. Left chelicerae, retrolateral view. 46. Left chelicerae, prolateral view. 47. Left maxillae, ectal view showing strikers and retrolateral basomedial cheliceral spines. 48. Left maxillae, intercheliceral pegs, prolateral view. 49. Stikers, retrolateral view. 50. Tar. IV, dorsal view showing trichobothria and tarsal organ. Scale bar = 5mm for 45, 46; 2mm for 47, 49, 50; 1mm for 48.

subSubSection.paragraph: Sternum ( Fig. 35 ): length 5.81, width 5.38. Slightly wider posteriorly than anteriorly, with thin even cover of short setae, interspersed with longer darker setae. No spines on border but very strong spiniform setae on lateral margins. Posteriorly between left/right cox. IV, sternal border slightly acuminate, lateral sternal points slightly acuminate. Sigilla ( Fig. 35 ): 3 pairs (not including labio-sternal sigilla), posterior, medium, 0.94 in length, ovoid, 2.1 lengths apart, 0.7–0.9 of their length from sternal margin. Median pair 1/3 size of posterior, similar in form, 0.2–0.1 of their length from margin. Anterior pair obscured, on margin. Labio-sternal sigilla small, almost rounded.

Legs: formula; length IV, I, II, III; width IV, III, I, II. Leg RF ~ 89.03. Setation: distal bands of short white setae on all segments, elongated cream/white setae on legs IV, reduced in comparison with other
Coremiocnemis species.
Leg lengths (fem., pat., tib., met., tar., total): holotype QM S83826 : palp: 6.98, 5.39, 5.33, 0.00, 4.52, 22.21. I: 9.10, 6.01, 7.83, 6.89, 4.65, 34.48. II: 8.64, 5.62, 6.41, 6.09, 3.87, 30.63. III: 7.60, 4.27, 5.27, 6.53, 3.67, 27.34. IV: 11.29, 5.68, 7.82, 9.35, 4.59, 38.73. Leg mid–widths (fem., pat., tib., met., tar., total.): palp: 1.97, 2.02, 1.66, 0.00, 1.91, 7.56. I: 2.69, 2.24, 2.05, 1.69, 1.67, 10.34. II: 2.50, 2.21, 1.62, 1.89, 1.78, 10.0. III: 2.61, 2.57, 2.10, 1.70, 1.43, 10.41. IV: 2.54, 2.48, 2.17, 2.14, 1.62, 10.95.
Scopula: met., tar. I–III undivided, met. and tar. IV divided by several rows of strong setae. Met. I, II: entire, III: 2/3, IV: 1/3 (just stronger retrolaterally).

Coxae: some small black thorns prolatero-dorsally, no thorns retrolaterally on I–IV. Coxae easily seen dorsally. I longest, ca. 1.2 times length of II. IV widest, slightly wider than length of III, basally rectangular with rounded corners. Coxae lack ventral thorns prolaterally on I–IV, strong dark setae only. I–III ventrally with many long thick blunt setae proximally, pallid. Some shortened dark setae, but no thick blacks. IV with mixture of medium length thick blunt setae proximally, pallid intermixed with shorter thin pallid setae. Ventral I–IV gently sloping anteriorly. Retrolateral setation: I–III with median narrow dark brush, IV pallid. I–IV retrolaterally lack ventral ledge. Ventral measurements for coxae: palp–length 5.96, width 2.91; I–5.92, 3.14; II–5.14, 2.77; III–4.52, 3.05; IV–4.81, 3.46.

Trichobothria: on all tarsi basal filiform field slightly wider than clavate field, merges evenly. Clavates on tar. I in distal 2/3, long filiforms only in basal 1/2, shorter filiforms intermixed with clavates distally. Clavate extent on II–IV cf. I, in distal 2/3. Shorter filiforms for length. Short epitrichobothrial field on I shorter than clavates, gradually increasing in length proximally.
Tarsal organ not evident on legs I–IV.
Spines: met. I with 1 DV, met. II with 1 DV, 1 DPV, 1 DRV, met. III with 2 DV, 1 DPV, 1 DRV, 1 DL, 1 DPL and met. IV with 2 DV, 1 DPV, 1 DRV, 1 DL, 1 DPL.
Claws: paired claws on all legs and palpal claw unarmed. Reduced third claw on leg IV.

Genitalia ( Fig. 37 ): epigastric fold 3.78. Spermathecae bilobular at 0.3 of lobe length basally; each bilobe with apical branching lobes at 0.75 of total lobe length, each emerges from main lobes inward toward each other (lateral lobes 1.6–2.0 length of medial lobes). Lobes lack apical swelling, lateral lobes as long as medials. All lobes very long thin, integral dark sclerotiation throughout. Epigastric fold extends ca. 2/3 length of medial spermathecal lobes.
Spinnerets: PMS: length 1.58, width (medially) 0.48. PLS: section lengths; basal 2.76, medial 1.54, apical 2.13. PLS section widths (medially); basal 1.24, medial 1.14, apical 0.88.

Male paratype ( QM S83927 ; as in female except) with body length 20.03
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 51–56.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , paratype male QM S83927. 51. Carapace, dorsal view. 52. Eyes, dorsal view. 53. Fovea, dorsal view. 54. Right maxillae, prolateral view showing lyra. 55. Right chelicerae, basodorsal view showing intercheliceral pegs. 56. Right chelicerae, lower retrolateral view showing strikers. Scale bar = 5mm for 51; 2mm for 52–54; 1mm for 55.

subSubSection.paragraph: Chelicerae: length 5.56, width at base of each lobe 2.02. Cheliceral teeth 11 in number with>35, basomesal teeth. Intercheliceral pegs (>6 larger,>16 smaller) in tight cluster on basodorsal surface ( Fig. 55 ).
Coxae ventral measurements: palp–length 4.32, width 2.32; I–3.88, 2.11; II–3.57, 1.97; III–3.07, 1.98; IV–3.59, 1.75.
Claws: paired as in female.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 57–58.
Coremiocnemis brachyramosa
sp. nov. , paratype male QM S83927. 57. Right palp, prolateral view. Right palpal bulb, prolateral view. Scale bar = 2mm for 57; 1mm for 58.

FIGURE 59.
Coremiocnemis gnathospina
sp nov., holotype female RMBR ZRC ARA.745 lateral habitus. Photo: D. Court.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution and natural history: Known only from the montane tropical rainforest slopes of Gunung Ledang, Johor , West Malaysia . Nothing is known about the natural history of
C. brachyramosa
.
